text: A good word is charity.
Do not get angry.
Do not abuse anyone.
Show mercy and you will be shown mercy.
Treat people with good manners.
Actions are judged by intentions.
Say the truth even if it is bitter.
Cleanliness is half of faith.
Modesty is a branch of faith.
Charity does not decrease wealth.
Spread peace among yourselves.
When you ask, ask Allah.
When you ask for help, ask it from Allah.
Fear Allah wherever you are.
I was sent to perfect good manners.
Seeking knowledge is a duty upon every Muslim.
The best of you are those who learn the Quran and teach it.
Your smiling in the face of your brother is charity.
There is a reward for serving any living being.
Removing harmful things from the road is charity.
Follow a bad deed with a good one and it will erase it.
There should be neither harm nor the causing of harm.
Whoever covers the faults of a Muslim, Allah will cover his faults.
Allah helps His servant as long as the servant helps his brother.
He who shows no mercy will not be shown mercy.
None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.
The strong one is not the one who wins in a fight, but the one who controls himself when angry.
Whoever prays the two cool prayers will go to Paradise.
When Ramadan begins, the gates of Paradise are opened.
The real patience is at the first stroke of a hardship.
Beautify the Quran with your voices.
Give the worker his wages before his sweat dries.
The best of you are those who are best to their families.
Whoever obeys me will enter Paradise.
Say I believe in Allah, and then be steadfast.
Truthfulness leads to goodness, and goodness leads to Paradise.
None of you should drink while standing.
Eat with your right hand and eat from what is near you.
The Muslim is one from whose tongue and hand others are safe.
Make things easy and do not make them hard.
Feed the hungry, visit the sick, and free the captive.
Be in this world as if you were a stranger or a traveler.
Leave what makes you doubt for what does not make you doubt.
Part of being a good Muslim is leaving what does not concern him.
The religion is sincere advice.
If you have no shame, then do as you wish.
Paradise lies at the feet of mothers.
The best of you are those with the best manners.
Every good deed is charity.
A kind word is charity.
Allah is gentle and loves gentleness in all things.
Do not envy one another.
Do not hate one another.
Be servants of Allah, as brothers.
Patience is a light.
Prayer is a light.
Charity is a proof.
The Quran is a proof for you or against you.
Whoever is not grateful to people is not grateful to Allah.
Allah loves that when one of you does something, he does it well.
Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should speak good or remain silent.
The best of people are those most useful to others.
The most beloved deed to Allah is the most regular one, even if it is small.
The one who guides to good gets the same reward as the one who does it.
Do good deeds properly, sincerely, and moderately.
Eat Suhur, for in Suhur there is a blessing.
A Muslim is the brother of a Muslim.
Whoever forgets a prayer, let him pray it when he remembers it.
O Allah, bless my nation in their early mornings.
Straighten your rows or Allah will change your faces.
None of you truly believes until he loves me more than his father, his children, and all people.
Offer some of your prayers at home.
The prayer made between the adhan and the iqamah is not rejected.
Do not turn your backs on one another.
He is not a believer whose stomach is full while his neighbor goes hungry.
The one who cares for a widow or the poor is like one who fights in the way of Allah.
If you want to soften your heart, feed the needy and be kind to the orphan.
Whoever plants a tree and it bears fruit, it is charity for him.
The world is a prison for the believer and a paradise for the one who rejects faith.
Whoever does not recite Al-Fatiha in his prayer, his prayer is not valid.
The earth has been made for me as a place of prayer and a means of cleansing.
Whoever is kind, Allah will be kind to him.
The best of homes is a home in which an orphan is well treated.
Tie your camel and then trust in Allah.
Do not take back your charity.
Whoever guards his tongue and his hands, I will guarantee him Paradise.
The one who eats and is grateful is like the one who fasts and is patient.
Allah does not look at your bodies or faces, but He looks at your hearts.
The best among you are those who are best in paying off debts.
Give glad tidings and do not drive people away.
The best days on which the sun rises is Friday.
Whoever helps someone in hardship, Allah will make things easy for him.
The best prayer after the required ones is the night prayer.
A charity given in secret puts out the anger of the Lord.
Whoever reads a letter from the Book of Allah will get a good deed.
The signs of a hypocrite are three: he lies when he speaks, he breaks his promises, and he betrays trust.
Your mother, then your mother, then your mother, then your father.
The best remembrance is: There is no god but Allah.
Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him be kind to his neighbor.
The best of charity is giving water to drink.
